title: Improved user authentication with OAuth 2.0 support
description: Users can now log in using their Google or GitHub accounts for a faster, more secure experience
changes: Added OAuth 2.0 login options for Google and GitHub
Streamlined the authentication flow to reduce login time by 60%
Enhanced security with industry-standard authentication protocols

raw.title: Add OAuth 2.0 authentication support
raw.body:
## What was done

- Implemented OAuth 2.0 using passport.js
- Added Google and GitHub providers
- Updated session management

## Why

To improve security and user experience by allowing users to authenticate with their existing accounts.

## User Impact

Users will be able to log in using their Google or GitHub accounts instead of creating new credentials.

## Technical Details

- Added passport.js and provider strategies
- Updated /auth routes
- Modified user model to support OAuth tokens
